io.gearpump.streaming.source

Interface DataSource

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TimeReplayableSource
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CollectionDataSource

    public interface DataSource
extends java.io.Serializable
    Interface to implement custom source where data is read into the system. a DataSource could be a message queue like kafka or simply data generation source.

    An example would be like 

    
  GenMsgSource extends DataSource {

    def open(context: TaskContext, startTime: TimeStamp): Unit = {}

    def read(context: TaskContext): Message = {
      Message("message")
    }

    def close(): Unit = {}
  }

    subclass is required to be serializable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes connection to data source.
      java.time.Instant getWatermark()
      Returns a watermark such that no timestamp earlier than the watermark should enter the system Watermark.MAX mark the end of source data
      void open(TaskContext context, java.time.Instant startTime)
      Opens connection to data source invoked in onStart() method of DataSourceTask
      Message read()
      Reads next message from data source and returns null if no message is available

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close()
        Closes connection to data source. invoked in onStop() method of DataSourceTask

      • getWatermark

        java.time.Instant getWatermark()
        Returns a watermark such that no timestamp earlier than the watermark should enter the system Watermark.MAX mark the end of source data
        Returns:
        (undocumented)

      • open

        void open(TaskContext context,
          java.time.Instant startTime)
        Opens connection to data source invoked in onStart() method of DataSourceTask

        Parameters:
        context - is the task context at runtime
        startTime - is the start time of system

      • read

        Message read()
        Reads next message from data source and returns null if no message is available

        Returns:
        a Message or null
